00007 //These defines are used for the BFS algorithm
00008 #define LEVEL_UP -1 //Indicating we are one level further from the source
00009 #define NEW_NODE -2 //Node was not reached yet
00010 #define QUEUE_NODE -3 //Node is in the queue
00011 
00012 //Static Members
00013 Graph* PushRelabel::g;
00014 Node* PushRelabel::nodeArr;
00015 unsigned long PushRelabel::numOfPushes;
00016 unsigned long PushRelabel::numOfRelabels;
00017 int PushRelabel::dist;

00020 //The main function - calculates the flow in a given graph
00021 int PushRelabel::calc(Graph* gr)
00022 {
00023         //Save pointers
00024         g = gr;
00025         nodeArr = g->getNodeArray();
00026 
00027         if (DEBUG >= LOG_3)
00028                 g->printGraph();
00029 
00030         //Start timing
00031         clock_t start, finish;
00032         start = clock();
00033 
00034         //Traverse all nodes (BFS) and initialize distance labels
00035         updateLabels(true, false);
00036         //Save the distance between the source and the sink
00037         dist = nodeArr[g->getSource()].getLabel();
00038 
00039         //Set source's excess flow
00040         nodeArr[g->getSource()].setExcess(INFINITY);
00041 
00042         //Put the source in the pool
00043         g->getPool()->addNode(&nodeArr[g->getSource()]);
00044 
00045         if (DEBUG >= LOG_2)
00046                 g->debugDump();
00047 
00048         //Reset the number of pushes and relabels
00049         PushRelabel::numOfPushes = 0;
00050         PushRelabel::numOfRelabels = 0;
00051 
00052         //Calc pre-flow
00053         preflow();
00054 
00055         if (DEBUG >= LOG_2)
00056                 g->debugDump();
00057 
00058         //Print out the number of pushes and relabels done by the algorithm
00059         if (DEBUG >= LOG_NONE){
00060                 cout << "# pushes: " << PushRelabel::numOfPushes << endl;
00061                 cout << "# relables: " << PushRelabel::numOfRelabels << endl;
00062         }
00063 
00064         //The excess of the target is the maximum flow
00065         int maxFlow = nodeArr[g->getTarget()].getExcess();
00066         cout << "Max flow value is " << maxFlow << endl;
00067         finish = clock();
00068         cout << "Phase 1 total clocks: " << (finish - start) << endl << endl << endl;
00069         //Reset the distance labels - this time from the source (in order to push excess flow back to the source)
00070         updateLabels(false, true);
00071 
00072         //Enqueue all the nodes with Excess > 0
00073         assert(g->getPool()->isEmpty()); //At this point the queue should be empty
00074         for (int i=1 ; i< g->getNodesNum() ; i++){ //No +1 here because we don't want the sink
00075                 if (nodeArr[i].getExcess() > 0)
00076                 {
00077                         g->getPool()->addNode(&nodeArr[i]);
00078                 }
00079         }
00080 
00081         //pre-flow to flow (remove excesses)
00082         flow();
00083 
00084         //Time the end of the run
00085         finish = clock();
00086         
00087         cout << "Total clocks: " << (finish - start) << endl << endl << endl;
00088 
00089         return maxFlow;
00090 }
00091 
00092 //Run a BFS and update the distance labels accordingly
00093 int PushRelabel::updateLabels(bool fromTarget, bool calcPrev)
00094 {
00095         int source;
00096 
00097         if (fromTarget)
00098                 source = g->getTarget();
00099         else
00100                 source = g->getSource();
00101         //The BFS algorithm uses a standard FIFO
00102         queue<int> nodeQueue;
00103         int cur;
00104 
00105         int level = 0;
00106 
00107         //Init all to NEW_NODE
00108         for (int i = 1; i <= g->getNodesNum(); i++)
00109         {
00110                 nodeArr[i].setLabel(NEW_NODE);
00111                 if (calcPrev)
00112                         g->prevArray[i] = 0;
00113         }
00114         //Push the source (distance 0) and set a level up
00115         nodeQueue.push(source);
00116         nodeQueue.push(LEVEL_UP);
00117         nodeArr[source].setLabel(QUEUE_NODE);
00118 
00119         if (DEBUG >= LOG_2)
00120                 cout << "Updating Labels..." << endl;
00121 
00122         //The main loop
00123         while (!nodeQueue.empty())
00124         {       
00125                 //Pop the next node in the queue
00126                 cur = nodeQueue.front();
00127                 nodeQueue.pop();
00128 
00129                 //Level up means we are one level further from the source
00130                 if (cur == LEVEL_UP)
00131                 {
00132                         if (nodeQueue.empty())
00133                                 continue;
00134                         level++;
00135                         nodeQueue.push(LEVEL_UP);
00136                 }
00137                 //We take a node marked as queue node and set its distance
00138                 else
00139                 {
00140                         if (DEBUG >= LOG_3)
00141                                 cout << cur << " (" << level << "), " ;
00142 
00143                         //Update Label
00144                         PushRelabel::nodeArr[cur].setLabel(level);
00145                         if (cur == g->getSource())
00146                                 g->setMaxDistance(level);
00147 
00148                         //Enqueue all children
00149                         EdgeEntry* edgePtr = PushRelabel::nodeArr[cur].getAdjList();
00150                         //Skip dummy
00151                         edgePtr = edgePtr->getNext();
00152                         while (edgePtr != NULL)
00153                         {
00154                                 //Only new nodes are enqueued
00155                                 if (nodeArr[edgePtr->getEndPoint()].getLabel() == NEW_NODE)
00156                                 {
00157                                         nodeQueue.push(edgePtr->getEndPoint());
00158                                         nodeArr[edgePtr->getEndPoint()].setLabel(QUEUE_NODE);
00159                                         //This is used to utilize the BFS to find a previous edges path
00160                                         if (calcPrev)
00161                                                 g->prevArray[edgePtr->getEndPoint()] = cur;
00162                                 }
00163 
00164                                 edgePtr = edgePtr->getNext();
00165                         }
00166                 }
00167         }
00168 
00169         if (DEBUG >= LOG_3)
00170         {
00171                 for (int i = 1; i <= g->getNodesNum(); i++)
00172                         cout << i << ": " << nodeArr[i].getLabel() << "\t";
00173         }
00174 
00175         return 0;
00176 }
00177 
00178 //After flow() we have the max flow at the target but we still need to have excess == 0 in all
00179 //the other nodes in the graph, this function pushes the flow back to the source
00180 int PushRelabel::preflow()
00181 {
00182         NodePool* pool = g->getPool();
00183         while (!pool->isEmpty())
00184         {
00185                 discharge(pool->getNode());
00186         }
00187 
00188         return 0;
00189 }
00190 
00191 //Discharge a node, push all the extra excess according to the Push-Relable algorithm
00192 int PushRelabel::discharge(Node* node)
00193 {
00194         bool search = false;
00195         int push_value = 0;
00196         int edges = 0;
00197         int level = 0;
00198         EdgeEntry* cur;
00199 
00200         //Nodes with no paths to target and the sink need not to be discharged
00201         if ((node->getID() == g->getTarget()) || (node->getLabel() == INFINITY))
00202                 return 0;
00203 
00204         //Set the first edge to cur (skip the dummy)
00205         level = node->getLabel();
00206         cur = node->getAdjList()->getNext();
00207 
00208         //Scan the edges
00209         while ((cur != NULL) && (node->getExcess() > 0))
00210         {
00211                 edges++;
00212                 //check if the arc is admissible (not saturated and label is 1 + end node label)
00213                 if (isAdmissible(node, cur) && (cur->getEndPoint() != g->getSource()))
00214                 {
00215                         // If the excess of the end node is 0, we add it to the pool
00216                         // (nodes with excess 0 are not in the pool)
00217                         if (nodeArr[cur->getEndPoint()].getExcess() == 0)
00218                                 g->getPool()->addNode(&nodeArr[cur->getEndPoint()]);
00219 
00220                         // Push on the edge, and push the opposite on the reverse edge
00221                         push_value = min(node->getExcess(), cur->getResCapacity());
00222                         push(node->getID(), cur, push_value);
00223 
00224                         // If we push to the target, we need to update the labels
00225                         if (node->getID() == g->getTarget())
00226                                 search = true;
00227                 }
00228 
00229                 cur = cur->getNext();
00230 
00231         }
00232 
00233         //Once we reach the target we "normalize" the labels
00234         if (search) 
00235                 updateLabels(true, false);
00236         else
00237         {
00238                 //If the node has no more excess set the new label
00239                 if (node->getExcess() == 0)
00240                 {
00241                         cur = findLowestLabelEdge(node);
00242                         if (cur != NULL)
00243                                 level = nodeArr[cur->getEndPoint()].getLabel();
00244                         else
00245                                 level = INFINITY;
00246                 }
00247                 //We don't relabel the source and the target
00248                 if ((node->getID() != g->getSource())
00249                         && (node->getID() != g->getTarget()))
00250                 {
00251                         //Since the source and the targets labels don't chance the max label is 2Xdist-1
00252                         if (level > (2*PushRelabel::dist)-1)
00253                                 node->setLabel(INFINITY);
00254                         else
00255                                 node->setLabel(level+1);
00256                         PushRelabel::numOfRelabels++;
00257                 }
00258         }
00259         //If the node should be returned to the queue for further discharge we return it
00260         if (node->getExcess() > 0 && node->getLabel() <=(2*PushRelabel::dist)-1 && (node->getID() != g->getSource()) && (node->getID() != g->getTarget()))
00261                 g->getPool()->addNode(node);
00262 
00263         return 0;
00264 }
00265 
00266 //Check if an edge is admissible for a push
00267 bool PushRelabel::isAdmissible(Node* start, EdgeEntry* edge)
00268 {
00269         return ((!edge->isSaturated()) && 
00270                 (start->getLabel() == nodeArr[edge->getEndPoint()].getLabel() + 1));
00271 }
00272 
00273 //Push 'value' flow on 'edge' in node id 'start'
00274 int PushRelabel::push(int start, EdgeEntry* edge, int value)
00275 {
00276         PushRelabel::numOfPushes++;
00277         if (DEBUG >= LOG_2)
00278                 cout << "push from " << start << " to " 
00279                 << nodeArr[edge->getEndPoint()].getID() << 
00280                 " (" << value << "), excess was: " <<
00281                 Utils::printValue(nodeArr[edge->getEndPoint()].getExcess()) << ", excess now: ";
00282 
00283         edge->push(value);
00284         nodeArr[edge->getEndPoint()].incExcess(value);
00285         nodeArr[start].decExcess(value);
00286 
00287         if (DEBUG >= LOG_2)
00288         {
00289                 cout << Utils::printValue(nodeArr[edge->getEndPoint()].getExcess()) << endl;
00290         }
00291         return 0;
00292 }
00293 
00294 //Push flow from the source to the sink, after this function
00295 //some nodes will be left with excess > 0 but the target will have its max flow
00296 int PushRelabel::flow()
00297 {
00298         if (DEBUG >= LOG_2) //Print the excess of each node
00299         {
00300                 cout << "Excess before flow" << endl;
00301                 for (int i=0 ; i<g->getNodesNum() ; i++)
00302                         if (nodeArr[i+1].getExcess() > 0)
00303                                 cout << "Node :" << i+1 << " Excess :" << nodeArr[i+1].getExcess() << endl;
00304         }
00305         //Extract nodes from the pull and push the flow back
00306         NodePool* pool = g->getPool();
00307         while (!pool->isEmpty())
00308         {
00309                 discharge_back(pool->getNode());
00310         }
00311 
00312         if (DEBUG >= LOG_2) //Print the excess of each node
00313         {
00314                 cout << "Excess after flow" << endl;
00315                 for (int i=0 ; i<g->getNodesNum() ; i++)
00316                         if (nodeArr[i+1].getExcess() > 0)
00317                                 cout << "Node :" << i+1 << " Excess :" << nodeArr[i+1].getExcess() << endl;
00318         }
00319         return 0;
00320 }
00321 
00322 //Push the flow back from a given node
00323 int PushRelabel::discharge_back(Node *node)
00324 {
00325         int extra, level, quantity;
00326         bool search = false;
00327         EdgeEntry *edge;
00328         Node *end_point;
00329 
00330         //Nodes with no paths to target and the sink need not to be discharged
00331         if ((node->getID() == g->getSource()) || (node->getLabel() == INFINITY))
00332                 return 0;
00333 
00334         extra = node->getExcess();
00335         //Main loop - as long as we still have excess in the node
00336         while (extra > 0) {
00337                 //Find the closest node to the source to push back
00338                 level = findClosestPushBack(node);
00339                 //No where to push back
00340                 if (level == INFINITY) break;
00341                 //Find an edge to push back
00342                 edge = node->getAdjList();
00343                 while (edge != NULL && extra > 0) 
00344                 {
00345                         //If we found a pushback - push back
00346                         if ((edge->getFlow() < edge->getCapacity()) && (nodeArr[edge->getEndPoint()].getLabel() == level)) 
00347                         {
00348                                 quantity = edge->getCapacity()-edge->getFlow();
00349                                 if (quantity > extra) 
00350                                         quantity = extra;
00351                                 edge->push(quantity);
00352 
00353                                 end_point = &nodeArr[edge->getEndPoint()];
00354 
00355                                 if (end_point->getExcess() == 0)
00356                                         g->getPool()->addNode(end_point);
00357 
00358                                 if (end_point->getID() == g->getSource()) 
00359                                         search = true;
00360 
00361                                 end_point->incExcess(quantity);
00362                                 extra -= quantity;
00363                                 node->decExcess(quantity);
00364                         }
00365                         edge = edge->getNext();
00366                 }
00367         }
00368         //We reached the source - update the labels
00369         if (search) 
00370                 updateLabels(false, false);
00371         else 
00372         {
00373                 //Update the labels
00374                 if (extra == 0) 
00375                         level = findClosestPushBack(node);
00376                 if (level > (2*PushRelabel::dist)-1)
00377                         node->setLabel(INFINITY);
00378                 else
00379                         node->setLabel(level+1);
00380 
00381         }
00382 
00383         node->setExcess(extra);
00384         return 0;
00385 }
00386 
00387 //Find the level closest to the source where you can push back
00388 int PushRelabel::findClosestPushBack(Node* node)
00389 {
00390         EdgeEntry* edge = node->getAdjList();
00391         Node* end_point;
00392     int min = INFINITY;
00393         //Scan the edges to find the min label
00394         while (edge!=NULL) {
00395                 if ((edge->getFlow() < edge->getCapacity()) && edge->isReverseEdge()) 
00396                 {
00397                         end_point = &nodeArr[edge->getEndPoint()];
00398                         if (end_point->getLabel() < min)
00399                                 min = end_point->getLabel();
00400                 }
00401                 edge = edge->getNext();
00402         }
00403 
00404         if (min < g->getTarget()) return(min);
00405         else return(INFINITY);
00406 
00407 }
00408 
00409 //Find the edge with the lowest label to return
00410 EdgeEntry* PushRelabel::findLowestLabelEdge(Node* node)
00411 {
00412         int min = INFINITY;
00413         EdgeEntry *tmp = node->getAdjList()->getNext();
00414         EdgeEntry *returnEdge = NULL;
00415         //Scan the edges
00416         while (tmp != NULL)
00417         {
00418                 if ((nodeArr[tmp->getEndPoint()].getLabel() < min) && (tmp->getResCapacity() > 0))
00419                 {
00420                         min = nodeArr[tmp->getEndPoint()].getLabel();
00421                         returnEdge = tmp;
00422                 }
00423                 tmp = tmp->getNext();
00424         }
00425 
00426         return returnEdge;
00427 }

00429 //Find a path using Dijkstra's algorithm
00430 int PushRelabel::dijkstraPath(void)
00431 {
00432         int *dist;
00433         int *prev;
00434         int i,max = INFINITY;
00435         EdgeEntry *tmp_edge;
00436         stack<int> s;
00437         //Time the recalc
00438         clock_t start, finish;
00439         start = clock();
00440         //Allocate the dist and prev ararys
00441         dist = new int[g->getNodesNum()+1];
00442         memset(dist,0,sizeof(int)*(g->getNodesNum()+1));
00443         prev = new int[g->getNodesNum()+1];
00444         memset(prev,0,sizeof(int)*(g->getNodesNum()+1));
00445 
00446         //Calc the distances from the source and from the target
00447         g->dijkstra(g->getSource(), dist, prev, max);
00448         //Scan the path found by the algorithm
00449         //Since we want to go from source to target we reverse the path using a stack
00450         i = g->getTarget();
00451         while( i!=0 )
00452         {
00453                 s.push(i);
00454                 i = prev[i];
00455         }
00456         //Now we follow the stack from source to target pushing the max flow found by Dijkstra's algorithm
00457         i = s.top();
00458         s.pop();
00459         while(i != g->getTarget())
00460         {
00461                 tmp_edge = nodeArr[i].getAdjList();
00462                 while (tmp_edge->getEndPoint() != s.top())
00463                         tmp_edge = tmp_edge->getNext();
00464                 push(i,tmp_edge,max);
00465                 i = s.top();
00466                 s.pop();
00467         }
00468         //Free the arrays
00469         free(dist);
00470         free(prev);
00471         //End time
00472         finish = clock();
00473         cout << "New max flow: " << nodeArr[g->getTarget()].getExcess() << endl;
00474         cout << "Total clocks for recalc: " << (finish - start) << endl << endl << endl;
00475 
00476         return 0;
00477         
00478 }
